page.title: 13Linslade-Places of Interest
page.content: There are many places of interest in Linslade, most of them are the churches. St.Barnabus is one of them. It was built in the 19th Century and is situated in New Linslade. The development of the railway running through Linslade made people move to houses around that area and the church was built for them. St.Mary's Church is situated in Old Linslade. It used to be the parish church, but now it is just open to the public for worship on a few days each year. The church was originally a Norman building and had its tower rebuilt in the 15th century. It has a stair turret and a wall which was to protect it against attack. Another place or interest is Linslade tunnel where the railway runs through. When you look at it, it looks like a castle.
